Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient: shows most elements clearly and correctly
CAN: The student can accurately draw and label at least one land habitat, such as a forest, with relevant features.
The student can draw and label at least one water habitat, like a pond, showing appropriate elements.
The student can illustrate and label different types of plants in each habitat, such as trees in the forest and aquatic plants in the pond.
The student can show and label various animals in each habitat, like squirrels in forests and fish in ponds.
The student can attempt to compare the variety of living things across habitats, showing some differences between land and water habitats.
CANNOT: The student may not consistently compare the variety of living things across habitats (may show more variety in one habitat than the other without explanation).
The student might struggle with identifying and illustrating patterns of different living things across habitats (incomplete labeling or variety may not be clearly depicted).
